Business Systems AnalystSalary: $83,038.92 - $100,087.80 AnnuallyJob Type: Full TimeJob Number: Business Systems Analyst-21Closing: 5/7/2021 11:59 PM PacificLocation: Norwalk, CADepartment: Business Systems Analyst-21Division: Student ServicesDescriptionClosing Date:This position will close on May 7, 2021 at 11:59 PM (or when 150 applications are received, whichever occurs sooner).2 positions available; 1 funded by General Funds; 1 Funded by Categorical FundsSummaryThe Business Systems Analyst, serves as a business analyst and technical support for information systems. The Business Systems Analyst analyzes current business processes and oversees the integration and implementation process of effective business practices into the appropriate information systems. The Business Systems Analyst works and collaborates with Instructional Technology professionals to determine if appropriate internal or external solutions currently exist, or whether new solutions are required and feasible. This position works with one or more area leaders, including the Vice Presidents, within one or more operational areas to align technology solutions with institutional strategies.Distinguishing Career FeaturesThe position requires expanded capability to consult with users from multiple functions, multiple platform applications, lead complex projects involving multiple departments/committees, work independently on multiple platforms. The incumbent in this position must have a solid understanding of PeopleSoft, and its integration with other moderate-to-complex systems (e.g., Degree Audit Reporting System, Student Records, SARS, EAB, ClockWork) and supporting data systems. This position will specify requirements for business information systems and incorporate new technical systems to improve workflow, production, efficiency, and effectiveness. Incumbents must have a strong knowledge of the business area that they support (student services, academic affairs, business services, finance, and/or HR information systems) and will demonstrate the ability to align key drivers and measures of success for the areas, including short- and long-term recommendations for related technologies.Job DutiesEssential Duties and Responsibilities:Perform system administration, including business process configuration, report development, end user training, and data management within the PeopleSoft enterprise resource planning (ERP) system environment.Analyze business requirements, select effective solutions and coordinate with other personnel from the area, IT, and management teams to ensure system integrity and efficient and effective systems operations; work closely with users to define and analyze business and operational problems; perform a variety of advanced analytical, internal consulting and project leadership/oversight duties to enable multiple stakeholders in the district to achieve business, administrative and academic objectives efficiently and effectively.Perform complex cross-departmental functional analyses including mapping, setup, system modeling, testing and troubleshooting of systems to recommend implementation practices; perform complex functional analyses of third-party computer applications, reporting functions, assessment, scanning and other testing; develop procedures and user manuals to maintain consistency of computer use throughout the district.Act as a liaison between business systems users in assigned departments and IT staff in the development, implementation, and enhancement of designated enterprise system modules; lead and facilitate the analysis of assigned area's business processes, practices and work/data flows for improvements and to ensure effective operations using enterprise system processes; identify integration points between modules from a data flow, business process and applications perspective.In cooperation with Instructional Technology, coordinate all assigned systems testing of module patches, fixes, and updates in the test database to ensure proper functioning of the revised system and proper integration with remaining systems; participate in functional end-user testing and check system integrity and integration prior to release to the production environment.Evaluate potential software solutions including off-the-shelf and open-source components and system architectures to ensure district business requirements are met; interact with vendors and attend vendor training as needed.Analyze, test, and model the results of system setup to determine appropriate functionality, performance, data integrity, and third-party software interface connections; make recommendations for system changes/corrections as needed.Assist user teams with special projects such as system upgrades and system implementations; evaluate requests for software enhancements; provide guidance to end users on application use and operating parameters; translate user expectations into technical specifications for enhancements and customizations; consult with other district staff on business process changes; research these changes for potential problems and develop and implement solutions.Provide training to end users on the use of applications; meet with users to provide information on system changes and address questions or issues; instruct users on setup and execution of specific processes; design and develop training materials; conduct or coordinate training sessions; evaluate training programs to ensure their effectiveness in meeting goals and objectives.Using advanced reporting tools, analyze, design and write specialized queries and custom reports to generate required data and reports on a periodic or ad hoc basis.Support of MIS/state/federal reporting requirements by assembling information, verifying accuracy, inputting and/or overseeing the input of information into various system databases and staying current with new requirements. If new requirements are needed, ensuring all technology is updated accordingly.Works with external agencies, independent contractors, vendors, and organizations on technology services, applications, and/or data requirements.Maintains up-to-date knowledge of evolving computer technologies, including hardware, software, languages, problem solving techniques, and development tools. Prepares periodic briefings on technologies related to the scope of work that would have relevance to the College.Perform other duties as assigned.Knowledge and Skills1. Thorough knowledge of the business area that they support (student services, academic affairs, business services, finance, and/or HR information systems) and problem solving in a collegiate environment.2. Principles, practices, and methods of business process and systems analysis, including business modeling using data and process flow diagrams.3. Demonstrated skills in eliciting and developing business requirements, specifying and designing inputs and outputs, producing system and programming specifications and requirements, and recommending modifications to existing programs and processes.4. System design theory, concepts, and principles including data management and administration and development concepts.5. Methods and practices for conducting unit and system testing and creation of test cases.7. Project management tools and techniques.8. Interrelationships of campus departments and their interrelated information systems.9. Functionality of the district's enterprise business system.10. Practices and techniques of training and instruction, particularly as related to computer software and applications, and development of user training materials.11. Personal computer hardware and software components.12. Operational characteristics of various computer programs and software packages.13. CIVIC Financial Services is a private money lender, specializing in the financing of non-owner occupied residential investment properties. CIVIC has funded over $4.0 Billion in loans since its inception, providing Mortgage Brokers and Real Estate Investors with a fast, cost effective funding source for their real estate investment needs.CIVIC is committed to creating a workplace where our people thrive, which translates into a culture of inclusion, recognition, and success for our teammates and clients alike. Since 2016, CIVIC has been recognized by Best Workplaces and Fortune as a Great Place to Work, and CIVIC’s employee engagement ranks among the top 5% of companies nationally.Whether you are an entrepreneur, an innovator, a game changer, a creative, a problem-solver, a thinker, or an operator we have all kinds. CIVIC is the place for smart, ambitious, dedicated people who work hard and play nice.Yes, our business is in real estate investing... but our greatest investment is in you!The Business Analyst, Valuations identifies which projects will achieve the organization and department business objectives. Reduces project rework, underutilized functionalities and requirements that are needed. Committed to the discovery and development of innovative solutions.What you'll do:Analyze and document systems and processes currently implemented.Collaborate with Project Managers, other business units and outside vendors to develop and manage project plans.Document data and reporting defects and help to determine root causes.Prepare scheduled reports and dashboards for value teams; synthesizing insights from disparate data sources.Research and analyze loan data, property specific data and/or macro trends for business opportunities.Constantly seeking ways to improve systems create efficiently workflows and enhance information in a strategic way that will positively impact the business.What you'll need:Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Accounting, Finance or related field required.2+ years of experience working as an Analyst, Data Scientist or Business Analyst required.Experience in real estate finance and working with real estate data preferred.Working knowledge in creating and enhancing custom dashboards using Tableau and Power BI.Knowledge of programming languages like SQL, Python, R and Scala preferred.Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite.What’s in it for you?We have a strong focus on going above and beyond when it comes to caring for our team members and our communities. In addition to traditional benefits like health insurance, casual Fridays, paid vacation, holidays and sick leave, we’re proud to offer these unique and enriching work perks:Celebrations: When we say we “work hard and play hard,” we mean it! We like to celebrate often via onsite and offsite happy hours, themed parties, parking lot BBQ's, milestone ceremonies, pot lucks, and Workout Tuesdays (to name a few).Investments: As we're in the lending space, we believe we should consistently and frequently invest in our CIVIC team. We give away money every month to help our teammates pay off student debts, participate in our loan and lending accounts, and reward them for their “grand ideas” that make CIVIC better.Comfortable Spaces: We like to make sure our teammates are well fed and can “find their zen” while at the office. Our kitchens are stocked with free snacks and beverages, in addition to catered breakfasts on Fridays and catered lunches multiple days per month. Many of our branches also have dedicated break spaces that are quiet, serene and perfect for relaxing.Education: Every other Tuesday, we encourage our team to take “900 Seconds of Genius" (15 minutes) to focus on a passion project or topic that helps them grow. We also offer an online curriculum of courses through our own CIVIC University.#CIVICCares Initiative: From beach cleanups, to food and clothing drives, to building homes for Habitat for Humanity, CIVIC provides several opportunities throughout the year for our team to step outside the office, bond, and come together to give back to our local communities.CIVIC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and welcomes applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

Company DescriptionAt Expert Institute, we’re building the smarter future of legal technology. Through our cloud-based expert service platform, Expert iQ, we empower attorneys with the expertise they need to win.

We’re proud to call some of the nation’s most prominent law firms as clients. Together with our network of over 3 million subject-matter experts, we’ve had a hand in securing over $20 billion in recovered value while working across recent civil rights, Big Tech, and major league sports-related litigation.

We’re making this all happen through a SaaS-enabled model: our team is the fuel helping the expert engine run. We’re a team of researchers, medical doctors, client advocates, business development leaders, and technologists. As we roll out new Expert iQ features, expand our client base, and onboard new experts, we’re always looking for growth-minded individuals to join the team.Job DescriptionExpert Institute is looking for a Business Analyst who will make a significant contribution to our strategic data analysis initiatives. You will have the opportunity to interact daily with senior leaders across a variety of departments, including the Executive team. Your efforts will provide multiple departments with analytical horsepower to drive operational goals.

We’re looking for someone who is a great team player, highly analytical and is able to clearly communicate their insights and findings. Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills are required as developing compelling presentations and analysis on strategic areas of focus will be a crucial part of the role. If you consider yourself to be a creative problem-solver and love using data to tell a story in a fast-paced environment, this could be a great opportunity for you.

Our Business Analyst will:

Directly support the CEO, President and other members of the Executive team by preparing regular and circumstantial analysis on a range of strategic topics
Develop in-depth knowledge about Expert Institute’s business model and operational processes
Present data-driven and actionable insights on subject matter ranging from sales performance to research efficiency and propose recommendations for improvement
Partner with senior leaders to assess the scope of their analytics needs and execute each project
Build, analyze and automate dashboards and reports
Collaborate with other members of the Strategy & Analytics team

Qualifications

2-4 years of relevant experience with strategy, reporting and data analytics
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics or other applicable area of study
Advanced Excel and Powerpoint skills are required
Familiarity with VBA and automation in Excel is a plus
Experience presenting to c-suite executives preferred
Knowledge of Salesforce is preferred
Process-oriented, self-driven, and strategic-minded
Proven ability to communicate with various levels of the team


Additional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

job_title: Business Analyst-Global Stock Selection, Research Engineering
description:
About AQR Capital Management

AQR is a global investment firm built at the intersection of financial theory and practical application. We strive to deliver concrete, long-term results by looking past market noise to identify and isolate the factors that matter most, and by developing ideas that stand up to rigorous testing. By putting theory into practice, we have become a leader in alternative strategies and an innovator in traditional portfolio management since 1998.

AQR takes a systematic, research-driven approach, applying quantitative tools to process fundamental information and manage risk. Our clients include institutional investors, such as pension funds, insurance companies, endowments, foundations and sovereign wealth funds, as well as financial advisors.

About the Team

The Global Stock Selection (GSS) Research Engineering (RE) group enables and supports Global Stock Selection Research at AQR. GSS RE maintains a sophisticated infrastructure and tooling environment in support of the business, as well as a complex production process including orchestrating numerous workflows with large amounts of data. GSS RE is responsible for signal generation and model construction as well as many other aspects of portfolio construction that go into the running of our strategies. Research Engineers work closely with researchers to create new systematic investment strategies and refine existing ones, applying technology expertise along with a practical understanding of markets to implement research ideas and develop systems that further enable the business.

Your Role

Our team is looking for an exceptionally talented individual to join the GSS Research Engineering team as a Quant Business Analyst. Research Engineering offers the opportunities to be involved with all aspects of research for our global portfolios, as well as collaboration with various parts of the firm. The candidate will work closely with the engineers and researchers to help coordinate, communicate, drive projects, and streamline work forward. In addition, supporting the engineers with additional domain context and experience, identifying work items and further streamlining and systematizing routine changes will also be a focus of this role. The individual will become intimately familiar with the research process and the investment philosophy which drives AQR. The candidate is also expected to gain detailed understanding of the GSS Research workflow and its interactions with other parts of the firm. Areas of responsibility will fall into three broad categories:


Project execution

Help defining and specifying projects, collaborating with other teams
Help coordinate researchers and engineers
Help translate research request and requirements into engineering tasks
Overseeing progress, staying on top of implementation
Testing and assuring final deliverables




Process engineering

Learn all aspects of the research engineering workflow
Help engineers with domain experience and context
Review code and provide constructive feedback
Gather feedback and generate ideas for business process enhancements
Work with researchers and key stakeholders on strategic improvements




Communication and Coordination

Help bridge any gaps between research and engineering
Work directly with engineers in support project deliverables
Help refine requirements and breakdown requests in specific work
Facilitation collaboration and communication between teams
Support India engineers to maximize value add



What You'll Bring

Bachelor's degree
3+ years of experience in the financial industry, dealing with complex business processes
Proven programming experience (Python, SQL, scripting languages)
Experience in quantitative research and finance domain
Prior experience implementing financial technology and business/system process re-engineering projects
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Who You Are

Well-organized and detail-oriented
Able to multi-task and keep track of various deadlines
Mature and thoughtful, with the ability to operate within a collaborative, team-oriented culture
Committed to intellectual integrity, with a high degree of ethics
Hard working and eager to learn in a highly intellectual, innovative environment

AQR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. EEO/VET/DISABILITY

KMK is a global data analytics and technology consulting company empowering leaders across the Life Sciences industries to make better data-driven decisions.

Our data analytics and software platforms support data science, commercial operations, real world evidence, and cloud information management. We help to optimize business strategy and operations by delivering cutting edge analytics from the broadest set of data sources, combined with deep technical and domain expertise. We enable commercial excellence delivering analytical guidance to the field through SalesOps, our cloud-based sales planning and operations platform. We are leaders in managing data using the latest cloud information management and big data technologies.

We have more than 170 employees worldwide, are growing rapidly, and are proud to count a number of the top 10 global Life Sciences companies as our customers. We serve clients with a high-touch on-site and onshore presence, leveraged by a global delivery platform.

Job Overview:

The Sr. Analyst, Market Access Analytics will be responsible for directly supporting the US Market Access team which includes Strategic Account Management, Payer Marketing, Contracting & Pricing

Key Responsibilities:

• Possesses strong understanding of Market Access landscape, claims data and managed care data; conducts analytics in Market Access space across BUs (e.g., market share vs. relative access, access-driven performance)

• Identifies market access trends / shifts, develops perspectives on payer behaviors, and analyzes prescriber plans, preferred positioning and market share

• Analyzes and reports on pull-through strategies to measure effectiveness and lift of formulary changes

• Coordinates with Market Access and Account teams

• Supports queries on specific managed markets-related issues

• Proactively identifies additional data sources / requirements for the business

• Provides quarterly updates to senior leadership on market access and market events

• Responsible for working closely with senior members of market access and marketing teams to report on channel mix for forecasting and variance reporting purposes

• Provides technical insights and trend analysis to the market access group and acts as a consultant to the brand and account groups.

• Assist in providing support to build strategies for the market access team

Qualifications:

• 4+ years of pharmaceutical experience, with at least 2 years in managed markets in an analytics capacity

• Extensive knowledge of various industry data sources such as: IMS Rx and Claims data (xPonent, xPonent Plantrak, DDD and HCOS) or Symphony Rx and Claims data (Prescriber, Prescriber/Payer, PHAST) + MMIT or Fingertip Formulary Data

Education requirement:

• Minimum requirement: Bachelors Degree with coursework in statistics, math and/or business. Graduate Degree preferred.

Technical Skills requirement:

• Proficiency in SAS, SQL, Access, Excel, PowerPoint, and other analytical + reporting tools

Knowledge & Skills:

• Experience with Pharmaceutical Benefit Managers, Consulting or Managed Care companies a plus.

• Analytical and/or technical proficiency at analyzing large data sets to derive insights, build models and forecast future business.

• Experience with pharmaceutical data and data visualization tools

• Must have demonstrated an ability to prioritize and manage projects

• Strong interpersonal and presentation skills and the ability to contribute individually and in team settings

• Proficient verbal and written skills

This position is based in Central New Jersey.

Powered by JazzHR

POSITION SUMMARYUnder minimal supervision, this position is responsible for detailed research and credit analysis of complex credit requests in Commercial Credit Underwriting. This is a senior position. The incumbent is expected to have comprehensive knowledge of credit & risk analysis, credit rules, structuring of credits, regulations and documentation with the ability to exercise independent judgment within established Underwriting Guidelines and Credit Policy. At this level, the incumbent is expected to increasingly work with and assist the Commercial Loan Officers on customer calls and structuring deals. The incumbent will show leadership in training less experienced staff members and handle more complex and/or challenging assignments (e.g., larger deals or complicated request with greater exposure to the Bank). The incumbent will have a key role of consequence to the team outside of their credit related work. For instance, being an Administrator of the Credit Quest workflow software.

MAJOR JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Analyze customer and prospect financial information for renewals and new business

10% Prepare loan approval and credit analysis, assist in structuring loans.

60% Spread financial statements and verify covenant compliance.

10% Accompany Commercial Loan Officers on customer and prospect calls. Participate in discussions with management regarding creditworthiness of proposed loan requests.

10% Prepares reports and handles special assignments.

10%
UPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

Subject to business needs may have supervisory responsibilities.

SKILLS AND TRAINING

Thorough knowledge of underwriting and credit analysis.

Strong analytical skills with ability to highlight and mitigate risks.

Knowledge of commercial real estate lending.

Proficient in Commercial & Industrial lending including debt service coverage and cash flow.

Strong knowledge of and the ability to practically apply, modern office software (MSword, Excel).

Strong verbal and written communication.

Ability to prioritize multiple projects and complete them on time.

Ability to conduct meetings, effectively present information and respond to questions from

peers, auditors and various levels of management.

Sound grasp of accounting.

EDUCATION

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or Economics. MBA preferred.

WORK EXPERIENCE

7 or more years in commercial banking

LICENSES AND/OR CERTIFICATES

Certification in Credit Risk or Credit Management preferred

WORKING CONDITIONS

Work is mainly performed in a normal office environment. Noise levels usually are moderate.

HAZARDS

The hazards are only those present in a normal office setting.

This job description may not be all-inclusive. Employees are expected to perform other duties as assigned and directed by management. Job descriptions and duties may be modified when deemed appropriate by management.

KMK is a global data analytics and technology consulting company empowering leaders across the Life Sciences industries to make better data-driven decisions.

Our data analytics and software platforms support data science, commercial operations, real world evidence, and cloud information management. We help to optimize business strategy and operations by delivering cutting edge analytics from the broadest set of data sources, combined with deep technical and domain expertise. We enable commercial excellence delivering analytical guidance to the field through SalesOps, our cloud-based sales planning and operations platform. We are leaders in managing data using the latest cloud information management and big data technologies.

We have more than 170 employees worldwide, are growing rapidly, and are proud to count a number of the top 10 global Life Sciences companies as our customers. We serve clients with a high-touch on-site and onshore presence, leveraged by a global delivery platform.

Overview:

The Senior Analyst will play a vital client-facing role in Patient Analytics business unit by managing and conducting various patient analytics projects and engagements to drive commercial success for top tier pharmaceutical clients.

Key responsibilities:

Lead and drive successful short-term and long-term project completion by closely collaborating with multiple internal and external stakeholders in a high pace, high pressure, full client-facing and cross functional environment.
Conduct patient health analytics, including patient adherence analyses by applying suitable analytical techniques (statistical and machine learning methods) to understand potential patient switches and treatment patterns, treatment adherence, patient survival analysis and patient assistance and intervention program effectiveness analyses across various disease areas, which can include: oncology, dermatology, diabetes, autoimmune, and /or cardiovascular disease areas.
Perform descriptive and predictive analytics using real world EMR and APLD data and provide insights into patient journey, decision making process and health outcomes
Drive business insights through KPI dashboards on key patient-centric programs on various distribution channels that provide Monthly and Quarterly Business Review framework and analysis to assimilate and evaluate brand performance across the commercial organization.
Participate in the development of a holistic, cross-functional point of view to address specific ad hoc sales and marketing or cross-functional business questions requiring integration of output from managed markets analytics, patient service analytics, and real world EMR data analytics.
Develop forecasting model (demand and patient) using key business insights from various market to support commercial excellence
Provide support to Commercial Leadership teams through ad-hoc analyses that may be needed to help facilitate field execution of sales and brand direction/strategy.
Demonstrate ability to create value by adding own and synthesizing groups insights.
Demonstrate ability to mentor and coach junior associates to achieve highest team performance and business growth

Qualifications:

Education/Experience

Bachelors degree in a Statistics, Economics, or other healthcare related major with quantitative background is preferredAdvanced degree in a relevant area is desirable but not necessaryThree or more years of conducting and managing patient analytics or health care commercial analytics experience required

Skills

Knowledge of various data pharma commercial data sources -- IMS Rx and Claims data (xPonent, xPonent Plantrak, DDD and HCOS) or Symphony Rx and Claims data (Prescriber, Prescriber/Payer, PHAST) + MMIT or Fingertip Formulary DataProficient in SAS with strong statistical analysis skillsProficient problem solving, coordination, strategic planning, quality management, project management skillsStrong coordination skills within and across team to meet clientStrong documentation skills; highly accurate, managing numerous projects simultaneously, and meeting strict deadlinesAttention to detail, attention to quality, and sense of urgencyDemonstrates the ability to coach/mentor others and identify potential mentors

WHO WE LOOK FOR

An SEI Consultant is a master communicator and active listener who understands how to navigate an audience. Self-aware, almost to a fault, SEI consultants keenly understand how to adjust their approach based on the situation. Following a logical, fact-based approach, our consultants possess the superior ability to see correlations others may not, ask the right questions and drive solutions.

As super-connectors, our consultants connect not only people, but data, trends and experiences. Mature, humble, and genuine, SEI Consultants frequently go above and beyond for both their clients and their colleagues. SEI Consultants are ethical and trustworthy individuals who do what they say. SEI Consultants have an insatiable curiosity and love to learn. These individuals are commonly tech savvy and early adopters. Their passion for learning is infectious and excites others.

As every project is different, an SEI Consultant must be adaptable and comfortable with unexpected situations. An SEI Consultant must be at ease with ambiguity because although a client knows that a problem exists – they need SEI to figure it out and drive a solution. SEI Consultants define ambition differently. SEI Consultants are authentic, low-maintenance individuals who like to hang out with colleagues outside of work. Whether it be cooking, traveling, hiking, or volunteering, SEI Consultants enjoy working with genuine, thoughtful folks who want to steer clear of the traditional grind and share the joy of day-to-day life and activities with colleagues, friends and family.

WHAT WE DO

Our consultants work with clients at all levels of the organization, from the C-suite to the shop floor, helping them to deliver on their most strategic initiatives. We’re known for making realistic, data-driven decisions that deliver value in tangible ways to our clients. Our clients ask for us on projects that require a superior combination of technical and business capabilities, people and management skills, and a collaborative mindset. We excel in understanding complex programs and strategic initiatives and breaking them into actionable pieces.

We work across a variety of industries and business functions and provide depth and breadth of experience across a core set of service areas:

Agile Transformation and Delivery Analytics and Business Intelligence Business Process & Transformation Organizational Change Management Information Management & Data Governance Program & Project Leadership & Execution Strategic Planning Vendor & Technology Selection User Experience (UX)

A career at SEI extends well beyond providing great service and thought leadership to our clients. Everyone takes an active role in building and managing our business, in an environment that runs counter to traditional consulting firms. Our consultants have a "seat at the table" and contribute to growing our business in ways that align to their interests such as growing business development opportunities, conducting interviews to support our hiring process, managing internal initiatives that build our brand or organizing trainings to share what you know with your colleagues. There is no telling what an SEI Consultant will be asked to do on a day-to-day basis – we do what it takes to get the job done.

QUALIFICATIONS

Required

Demonstrated business acumen Proven track record of delivering results Experience working with and/or leading a team Ability to work independently Ability to work across industries, roles, functions & technologies Positive can-do attitudeAuthorization for permanent employment in the United States (this position is not eligible for immigration sponsorship)

Preferred

Bachelor’s degree Minimum 8+ years professional experience Consulting experience Experience across our service offerings Professional certifications (e.g. PMP , Scrum, Agile)

Why is this role critical? The Financial Data Analyst is responsible for providing proactive financial and accounting leadership and complex analytical support in the development, implementation, and execution of business and corporate strategic objectives.

A Day in the Life: The Financial Data Analyst role is a newly created role that will support the integration of three high growth businesses, creating an opportunity for the right candidate to influence decision making in a fast paced, high growth environment. Working with the divisional CFOs and Controllers, the right candidate will be responsible primarily for revenue and cost modelling to allow for a greater understanding and tracking of the main components that drive the revenue and profitability of our business by product line and customer as well as making recommendations to upper and executive-level management and stakeholders, such as investors and lenders that will influence revenue growth and profitability. Office Title: QA Analyst
Seniority level: Junior to Mid-level
Department: Quality Engineering
Salary Range: N/A
Work location: New York, NY
Hours/Shift: Full time
Reports To: Enterprise QA Manager

Job Description
Affinity Solutions is looking for a junior/mid-level QA Analyst to join our Quality Engineering team. The QA Analyst is responsible for developing and supporting the planning, design and execution of test plans, test cases/scripts for our client websites and software applications. You will work closely with various departments to execute and validate test cases based on business requirements. You will be responsible for making sure that the end product meets our highest quality standards. Other responsibilities include content/email proof reading.
The ideal candidate should have experience software quality assurance testing in a manual/automated capacity. You should demonstrate strong attention to detail and possess solid analytical and problem-solving skills. You should be comfortable with the entire Software Development Life Cycle and have working experience in an Agile and/or Waterfall methodology environment. You should be able to communicate test results with the appropriate teams in a timely, clear and concise manner to facilitate efforts to fix and re-test.
Responsibilities

Creation and execution of testing work products - test plans, test cases, requirements traceability matrices, data mapping, and defect management
Software test execution and delivery for desktop, mobile and data applications
Convert complex business requirements and use cases to test plans and test cases
Accessibility (ADA) testing to ensure legal compliance
End-to-end functional and system testing
Perform cross browser testing for websites
Query databases using SQL to validate for data accuracy
Perform RESTful API testing via client HTTP tools
Proof-reading content for grammar, style, brand and validating the accuracy and completeness of content updates to websites and emails
Multitask and prioritize a high volume of work under tight deadlines
Communicate with senior level management to provide updates on project status and timeline

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer science or related field
3+ years of experience in software testing for web/mobile applications
Experience with multiple layers of testing environment (UAT, Production)
Experience writing and executing test plans and test cases
Experience with testing web-based software and RESTful API services
Strong proficiency in SQL: query, insert, update, join
Experience working in an Agile environment
Experience with defect management tools (Jira, Bugzilla or similar applications)
Able to take lead on projects from the test case creation/execution through the production rollout while managing deadlines and resources
Attention to detail for proof-reading, content and email rollouts
Experience with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook)

Nice to have

Master’s degree in Computer science or related field
Software testing certifications (ISTQB, QAI)
Programming skills (Python, Java)
Experience in automation testing with Selenium (Python test framework)

COMPANY SUMMARY

Acquis Consulting Group is a consulting firm specializing in strategy and implementation. We partner with clients to enable growth that is both measurable and meaningful. We help our partners create new ways to think about their business, but we don’t stop there. We see projects through and help implement business ideas, turning them into lasting business value.

Acquis serves both domestic and international organizations from our headquarters in New York City and satellite offices in California, Massachusetts and New Jersey. Acquis supports industry leading enterprises through high profile projects that span strategy and execution.

COMPANY CULTURE

We sustain our culture through careful analysis of new and experienced hires and go to great lengths to hire individuals that will add to the experience of working at Acquis. Our core values at Acquis are People First, Advance Together and Think +Do.

People First:One of our greatest priorities is to attract, develop, and retain top talent. Accordingly, we have created a “second family” environment where each individual has an opportunity and obligation to contribute to our shared success. We measure this success not only through our delivery excellence but through the satisfaction of the people that work here. We believe that we have created a unique environment that balances autonomy with responsibility, offering the ability to learn by doing while providing a careful balance of oversight. Acquis is a learning organization that is built on the premise that our employees can add value from day one.

Advance Together: Acquis brings insight, passion, and intelligence to the lasting relationships we establish with leading enterprises. We measure ourselves through our clients’ success utilizing the agility, creativity, and focus of a smaller firm.

Think+Do: Acquis provides our clients with strategic insights and also helps deliver them. Acquis consultants can advise our clients on their critical business issues, develop creative ways to address their challenges, and help implement these solutions.

POSITION OVERVIEW

Acquis Consulting Group is seeking a few intelligent and skilled consultants to act as Engagement Managers. Candidates must have 5-10 years’ experience as management consultants, including experience in a project manager capacity.

As a growth organization Acquis requires its Engagement Managers to be self-starters who will contribute to and lead internal company development initiatives. Engagement Managers will also at times be asked to contribute to business development and sales activities. Candidates must be proactive with proven positions of leadership.

Mental agility and the ability to learn are paramount. The ability to take on new challenges and succeed beyond one’s comfort zone is required.

SCOPE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Acts as an incisive, effective creative thinker bringing business and consulting experience to client engagements and applies expert skills in communication, research, problem-solving, and analysis to client work.
Leverages business context to analyze and improve complex business models.
Explains and reviews analysis/findings with team members and client personnel.
Assesses presenting problem with appropriate project scope and decomposes problem to identify root causes.
Identifies implications of proposed solutions on people, processes, technology, strategy and structure.
Leads Acquis and external resources on both small and large-scale client engagements.
Manages in a hands-on capacity utilizing detailed knowledge of the engagement situation while also maintaining focus on the larger context and overall project view.
Builds an effective business case for proposed solutions.
Converts existing Acquis engagements, client relationships, and goodwill into additional potential opportunities.
Thrives in an entrepreneurial, results-oriented, small business environment.

EDUCATION

BS or BA (Business, Finance, Engineering, Computer Sciences preferred)
MBA is not required; only MBAs with prior consulting experience are considered

SKILL SET AND EXPERIENCE

Preferred consulting backgrounds include but are not limited to:

Capability Development
Cost Management and Reduction
New Product and Service Development
Post-Merger Integration
Procurement
Shared Services
Travel, Expense and Meetings

Preferred skill sets include but are not limited to:

Analytics and Reporting
Change Management
Operational Strategy
Process Engineering
Program and Project Management
Systems Implementation

PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES

Well-rounded – You have a wide range of skills, interests, and an exceptional work ethic.
Positive – No job is too big or too small for you. You take your work seriously, but you don’t take yourself too seriously.
Adaptive – You enjoy being outside of your comfort zone. You tackle ambiguity, change, and new challenges with enthusiasm.
Quick-learning –You have the mental agility to self-start and succeed in a fast-paced environment.
Analytical – You have a passion for data-driven problem solving.
Results-oriented – You do what it takes to get the job done right and have the fortitude to see it through.
Customer-focused – You are passionate about the success of your client.
Collaborative – You’re the consummate team player, and everyone wants to be on your team.

Positioned within the Medical Economics department, the Medical Cost team values, implements, and tracks initiatives aimed at producing savings and bending cost trends. The team is empowered with the resources it needs to produce results and deliver impactful business recommendations. As a Senior Medical Economics Analyst, you’ll map out and construct detailed analyses, confront challenging and unfamiliar subjects, and interface with stakeholders across all departments and lines of business. The conclusions you reach have the potential to improve and influence the organization, playing an essential part in our mission to provide members with affordable and accessible high quality care. Each day you’ll tackle new and unique questions, learning and growing as you develop strategies, find solutions, and build innovative new approaches that support our goals and drive success.The role involves managing projects from analysis to implementation and beyond, ensuring that results are achieved and leadership is aware of the unique headwinds and tailwinds faced by any initiative. The ability to simplify complex scenarios into key takeaways is essential, as is the ability to explain and drill into any given detail behind the analyses you create. You’ll be expected to make independent decisions and support them under scrutiny. Potential areas of analysis include payment policy, utilization management, and value-based payment arrangements. The ideal candidate will be eager to learn, excited to grow, ready for a challenge, and able to thrive in a collaborative and collegial work environment.Job Description & Duties:Value new medical cost initiatives, applying financial modeling expertise and using independent judgement to determine the best methods and approaches to calculate accurate estimates of program savings.Provide data driven analysis to Finance, Claims, Medical Management, Network and other departments to enable critical decision making.Coordinate program implementation with initiative owners and establish controls to validate that changes have occurred.Thoroughly vet and perform due diligence on potential value based arrangements to assess financial impact, ensure operational feasibility, and identify impact on existing programs.Identify favorable and unfavorable performance trends within medical cost initiatives, communicate trends to leadership, and recommend changes to initiative owners to improve performance.Perform complex return on investment analyses for vendors to determine if their financial and clinical performance is achieving desired results.Keep abreast of New York Medicaid and Medicare reforms and their impact on Healthfirst and their owner hospital performance.Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution.Analytical work experience within the healthcare industry (i.e. hospitals, network, ancillary, medical facilities, healthcare vendor, commercial health insurance company, large physician practices, managed care organization, etc.)Work experience with SAS and/or SQL where you have created queries, pulled large data sets and performed data manipulations/analysis.Experience with MS Excel functions that include working with large data sets, creating standardized reports, utilizing vLookups and advanced functions/ formulas; creating, using and interpreting pivot tables, filtering and formatting.Knowledge of healthcare financial terms such as cost, utilization, Per Member Per Month (PMPM) and revenue.Basic understanding of Medicaid and Medicare programs or other healthcare plans.Self-motivated, creative problem solver who can work independently and collaborate through strong communication and interpersonal skills.Preferred Qualifications:Strong project management experience and ability to handle multiple projects in a fast paced environment.Demonstrated understanding of key managed care concepts and provider reimbursement principles such as risk adjustment, capitation, FFS (Fee-for-Service), Diagnosis Related Groups (DRG’s), Ambulatory Patient Groups (APG’s), Ambulatory Payment Classifications (APC’s), and other payment mechanisms.Understanding of value based risk arrangements.Experience using Tableau.WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. Applicants and employees are considered for positions and are evaluated without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, genetic information, military or veteran status, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other protected Federal, State/Province or Local status unrelated to the performance of the work involved.If you have a disability under the Americans with Disability Act or a similar law and want a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, please contact us by sending an email to careers@Healthfirst.org or calling 212-519-1798 . In your email please include a description of the accommodation you are requesting and a description of the position for which you are applying. Only reasonable accommodation requests related to applying for a position within Healthfirst Management Services will be reviewed at the e-mail address and phone number supplied. Thank you for considering a career with Healthfirst Management Services.

Why Provident

Provident Credit Union is member-owned, trusted, financially sound, technologically advanced, and provides "world class" value, convenience, products and services to all members. We are headquartered in Redwood Shores, CA and have 21 branches located throughout the San Francisco Bay Area, and Folsom.

Job Summary:

Works as liaison among stakeholders in order to elicit, analyze communicate and validate requirements for changes to business processes that directly affect information systems. Understands business problems and opportunities in the context of the requirements, recommends and implements technology solutions that enable the credit union to achieve defined goals.

Essential Functions:

May work independently or with a project team to analyze and document business requirements, propose and implement technology solutions.
Collaborate with the developers to ensure internally developed solutions meet or exceed the documented business requirements.
Collaborate with Quality Assurance Analysts to develop test scripts and automated testing for application changes.
Conduct gap analysis and recommend solutions for critical business processes. May facilitate user acceptance testing.
Facilitate workshops, capture and analyze requirements and decompose high-level information into details. Present business requirements in a user friendly business requirements document.
Develop project plan, test plans, communication and reporting for all core system releases and hot fixes.
Facilitate Triage meetings to discuss and resolve member facing issues and challenges.
Set up and maintain master project plan for the IT Department.
Maintain meeting schedules, minutes, issues logs and documentation as assigned.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Excellent written communication skills.
Complete required BSA & OFAC training annually.
Understand and adhere to BSA and OFAC policy and procedures.

Education/Work Experience:

Bachelor's Degree in computer science, systems engineering or equivalent experience
5+ years of relevant technology experience
5+ years of project management experience
5+ years of leading platform implementation of core enterprise applications

The position demands maturity, flexibility and someone ready to contribute at a high leveland the rewards that come with it.

Fully paid health insurance premiums
Quality medical, dental and vision care coverage
401(k) retirement plan with matching employer contributions
Strong commitment to investing in your career and educational advancement by offering up to 100% tuition reimbursement for approved courses
Incentive plan
Generous paid time off and paid holidays
Flexible spending accounts
Short and long-term disability coverage
Life and AD&D insurance
Provident membership
Rate discount on home and auto loans
In-house training
And much more!

Provident is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Golden 1 Credit Union is a great place to grow your career in the mortgage industry! You will work directly with consumers and our more than 1 million members to purchase their dream home.


	JOB TITLE: Home Loans Business Process Analyst



	DEPARTMENT: Home Loans Admin



	STATUS: EXEMPT



	JOB CODE: 10062



	GENERAL DESCRIPTION:

The Home Loans Business Process Analyst is responsible for identifying enhancement, development, and customizations of Home Loan systems. This position requires in-depth knowledge of the loan origination workflow and the job functions of all operational roles that participate in that workflow. The Business Process Analyst works closely with Home Loans management to evaluate the business process, systems, data integrity, and compliance issues as they relate to the home loan systems.



	TASKS, DUTIES, FUNCTIONS:

Provide technical direction and support in the development of processes and workflows in the use of Loan Origination System, Point of Sale, CRM, Pricing Engine, etc. Responsible for analysis, planning, testing, and implementation of projects and tasks.Build, test and implement new system enhancements such as business rules, custom input forms, workflows, and third-party integrations.Manage enactments, process changes and implementations of Loan Origination System, Point of Sale, CRM, Pricing Engine through testing of new functionality, deployment to a production environment, and communication to end users.Provide solutions for internal support issues by troubleshooting and resolving issues in a timely manner and escalating to Enterprise Applications or software vendor as needed.Monitor industry and/or regulatory changes to ensure systems can support changes.Work with the Home Loans Management to develop, maintain, and enhance the home loans digital offering from origination through closing.Review and recommend Home Loan process and systems to create operational and production efficiencies.Lead process and system enhancement efforts for home loans.Understand the definitions and configuration of company's Loan Origination System, Point of Sale, CRM, Pricing Engine, etc.Coordinate with Home Loans Trainer to deliver training to business units on new features.Additional related duties may be assigned, as required.Maintain a thorough understanding of state and federal laws and regulations related to credit union compliance including bank secrecy and anti-money laundering laws appropriate to the position.



	PHYSICAL SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND EXERTION UTILIZED IN THE PERFORMANCE OF THESE TASKS:

Effective oral and written communication skills required.Must possess sufficient manual dexterity to skillfully operate an on-line computer terminal and other standard office equipment, such as financial calculators, personal computer, facsimile machine and telephone.



	ORGANIZATIONAL CONTACTS & RELATIONSHIPS:

INTERNAL: All levels of staff and branch/department managers.EXTERNAL:Training associations, community organizations and vendors.



	QUALIFICATIONS:

EDUCATION: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in related field.EXPERIENCE: Three years or more experience in administrating software applications such as Ellie Mae Encompass, Optimal Blue, FNMA & FNMA technology solutions and Customer Relationship Management software such as Mortgage Returns. A minimum of 2 or more year’s mortgage lending experience preferred. Experience in project management and implementation a plus.KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS:

Able to effectively articulate and communicate instructional requirements for content, clarity, style, spelling, and grammar.Perform productively with ability to meet short timelines. Strong team skills and the ability to work constructively and collaboratively with management, peers, and other departments. Able to quickly comprehend technical applications, documentation and instructions and to translate to practical terms.3 to 5 years of Encompass Administration experience.Experience in configuration of all areas of Encompass settings including personas, user groups, e-Folder, loan templates, reports, input form builder, and all types of business rules.Strong understanding of the loan lifecycle.Ability to analyze problems and respond quickly in a fast-paced, demanding environment.Multi-tasking capabilities.Strong communication skills and customer service.Demonstrates a professional and cooperative attitude.Capacity to write and test business rules and custom field coding for Encompass360.Microsoft Excel functions like formulas, pivot tables, and macros.Additional related duties may be assigned, as required.



	PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

Prolonged sitting throughout the workday with occasional mobility required.Corrected vision within the normal range.Hearing within normal range. A device to enhance hearing will be provided if needed.Occasional movements throughout the department daily to interact with staff, accomplish tasks, etc.



	LICENSES/CERTIFICATIONS:

Certification in Word, Excel, and other Microsoft applications, Encompass Administration a plus.

A valid California Driver’s License is required.

About our Business: 

For every individual and family, two of their biggest life purchasing decisions involve buying a car and a house. We are the company working behind the scene with our clients to create industry leading technology that ensures the experience is secure and easy for consumers. Each year, we are proud to help millions of people realize their ownership dreams. Our clients, who are Blue chip lenders and high-growth brand name disruptors trust us to help them address and anticipate the ever evolving lending landscape. Over the years, we earned the industry’s choice for scalable performance and innovative technology that connects lenders with the people that they serve

This is one of the most exciting times to join our team because of a recent joint venture agreement between our previous parent company Fiserv and private equity firm Warburg Pincus. With this agreement, we are backed by both the legacy of a Fortune 500 company that has been voted one of the World’s Most Admired Companies and the growth expertise of a leading investment group.

About the Role: 

Operate primarily in a tactical role across the SDLC to translate business and user requirements into functional specifications with a level of detail that can be used for development. Assist in the creation and implementation of software solutions either by working with developers on new systems or creating ways to use existing systems more efficiently. Where applicable work with users to understand the business problem and developers to solve those problems. Work with developers to design unit and system test plans and implement said plans.

Essential Job Responsibilities:

• Prepares business specifications from which technical specifications are formulated.

• Serves as a liaison between the internal product community, the software development team and where applicable, customers, to gather and communicate requirements which help define and verify product design.

• Conduct preliminary investigation of product defects and project requests.

• Reviews requirements, specifications, and test plans to ensure they are in line with business objectives.

• Generate, track, update and report on feature and bug cases in the issue/change tracking system,

• Create visual modeling or diagramming of the current and proposed work flows where applicable.

• Serve as a resource for engineering and quality assurance; clarifying requirements throughout the software development life cycle.

• Maintain and update requirements documentation as needed throughout the software development life cycle.

• Work with cross-functional teams to define detailed plans, monitor product development and release cycles across products using agile methodology.

• Work with the Quality Assurance team to record and/or review test plans, test scenarios, and test cases results in preparation for regression testing and product validation.

• Make recommendations to improve business processes. Assists in root cause analysis in order to recommend product enhancements or other appropriate actions to improve productivity for the business units.

• Utilize systems and data to resolve business issues in the most effective manner.

• May provide operational business related analysis and research to support business goals.

• Responsible for completing company provided training as well as independent, self-directed learning of internal solutions, tools and the industry to establish domain and subject matter expertise.

• Perform other duties as required.

Required Qualifications:

Education:

• Bachelor’s Degree in business, computer science and/or related field required.

• Equivalent work experience may be substituted.

Job Related Experience:

• 7+ years work-related experience.

• Mortgage loan servicing experience preferred.

• The ability to interact with external, as well as, internal clients for the purpose of data gathering and design initiation.

• Strong analytical skills.

• Strong written and oral communication skills are required.

Position Requirements:

• A strong knowledge of programming (i.e. program design, flowcharting, coding, testing, debugging, etc.).

• A strong knowledge of how the pieces of a program fit together for the purpose of meeting the requirements of an application.

• A strong knowledge of how to document program design, coding, and maintenance.

• A strong understanding of how critical project completion is to client satisfaction.

• Proficient in using Microsoft Office Suite.

• Capable in SQL Queries.

 *Position can be remote.

Are you a psychology or education major looking for clinical, hands on experience with children?Are you the type of person who wants to help others and cares deeply for children and their future?Are you a behavior analyst who wants to do right by children and learn about science, not just make money?If you answered yes to any of these questions, then The ABRITE Organization is the clinical team for you to join! We are a group of behavior analysts who are doing right by children and their families (according to the established practices of the science of behavior analysis) while staying separate from business and the financial bottom line.The ABRITE Organization is seeking enthusiastic, motivated board certified behavior analysts to assist in the delivery of home and school based behavior analytic services for children identified with learning delays ranging in age from birth to 15 years of age. We are currently hiring for our Santa Cruz, Santa Clara, and Southern California offices. The developmental delays of our children range from language only deficits to children diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder.The ABRITE Organization was founded by doctorate level clinicians based on a tremendous love and passion for working with children and a commitment to implementing behavior analysis with the highest level of integrity. A vision and dedication to a team that maintained these same values has resulted in a growing organization with many unique qualities including doctoral level behavior analysts guiding and supervising clinical and administrative processes, a research-practitioner model which provides our team members with opportunities to conduct and present research at regional and international conferences, and a unwavering focus on the progress of our clients. At ABRITE our efforts are collective and our commitment to the clients and families we serve to the science of behavior analysis, and to each other are unparalleled. If you are interested in joining a team that offers endless support and aims to make powerful impact at the level of the individual client AND to our science, we greatly encourage you to apply.We are searching for unique applicants who must exhibit a diverse repertoire encompassing skills to promote language acquisition as well as an understanding of increasing skills across all developmental domains. In addition, the applicant must demonstrate skills in functional assessment and treatment of behavioral excesses based on the empirically supported behavior analytic methodologies. The applicant must possess the following:Master's degree in psychology (preferred), education, or special educationBoard certification in behavior analysis (BCBA)A minimum of 3 years of experience working with children using the principles of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA)Qualified clinicians who are bilingual (English/Spanish) are highly encouraged to applyWe are offering a competitive salary and benefits package based on an individual's experience. If you are interested in applying for this position, please view our website at www.abrite.org.

description: Position Summary*The Candidate, who reports to the Senior Director of Service Management, is the Service Management Product Lead for ITS and is responsible for maintaining the ServiceNow application, managing incidents related to ServiceNow, and performing enhancements and development to advance the campus’s ServiceNow capabilities.The Service Management Product Lead shall be responsible for enhancing the ServiceNow implementation to advance the campus’s service management roadmap. Plug and Play

Plug and Play is a leading global innovation platform. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, we run accelerator programs, corporate innovation services, and a venture capital arm. Together these programs are a catalyst for technological innovation. Since inception in 2006, Plug and Play has expanded worldwide to over 20 locations globally, giving startups the necessary resources to succeed in Silicon Valley and beyond. Plug and Play’s innovation platform connects over 10,000 startups and over 280 corporate partners. We invest in startups across the world, alongside elite venture capital firms. Startups in our community have raised over $7 billion in funding, with successful portfolio exits including Guardant Health, Dropbox, Honey, and PayPal.

Portfolio Analyst Summer Intern

Plug and Play is seeking an entry-level Portfolio Analyst intern. The Portfolio Analyst intern will gain valuable business and legal experience analyzing the performance of Plug and play’s many investment verticals and providing the data in neat and informative reports. The work will be complex and challenging, but the reward will be highly marketable skills for recent graduates who are interested in finance, venture capital, law, business, or technology.

The Portfolio Analyst intern will work within Plug and Play’s Legal Department but it is not required for applicants to have a legal background! The Portfolio Analyst intern will be involved in multiple aspects of the startup/venture capital world. People with a variety of interests can gain great experience that will translate into diverse fields.

Job Duties:


 Input data into Excel, Google Sheets, and Playbook (Plug and Play’s proprietary investment management software)
 Generating status reports and maintaining complex excel charts that track investment portfolio data
 Ensure Plug and Play’s investment data is reported to Pitchbook, CBinsights, and Crunchbase accurately and on time
 And all general office/administrative duties that are required for this position
 As knowledge and experience increases, take ownership of new and different requests and add value through new job skills and accomplishments

The ideal candidate:


 Working towards to a bachelor degree with one or more semesters remaining
 Finance, MIS, Economics and Business Majors preferred
 Excellent written communication skills
 Highly proficient in Excel and Google sheets (VLOOKUP, Index and Match, IF functions)
 Proficient in polite chitchat
 Comfortable with Microsoft Office
 Self-starting and able to work without much supervision
 Able to understand and synthesize complex ideas

PubNub is the leader in real-time communications for developers, startups and enterprises. Its Data Stream Network (DSN) provides enterprise-grade security, 99.999% SLA-backed reliability and PubNub is proud to be an EEO employer.Job Summary:PubNub is looking for an experienced analyst to join the Data and Analytics team and help us identify data-driven insights to grow efficiently. As PubNub accelerates its growth, we are looking to add top analytics talents to our Data & Analytics team to expand our data-driven practice. We welcome candidates who possess a strong business acumen, exceptional analytical skills and ability to always go one step beyond.Responsibilities:Make sense of the data. You will be responsible for navigating various databases and systems to understand the data and connect the dots. You will be expected to check any potential data problems before you present it to the business. You must own the source of the truth for our data.Fix and clean up the data. You will be responsible for monitoring and communicating any data problems effectively with Operations (sales/salesforce, marketing/marketo, support/zendesk, etc), Product and Engineering and make sure to fix them thoroughly on a constant basis. To do it successfully, you are expected to go one step beyond to identify the root cause of data problems and suggest long-term solutions to minimize future data problems.Own the data pipelines. You will be responsible for building data pipelines using SQL and Python in Airflow to create staging tables to support business reporting and analysis needs. You are not only expected to construct datasets that are useful and scalable, but also are expected to make constant changes to existing and new data pipeline jobs to reflect new business requirements and optimize pipeline performance.Provide analytical support. You will be responsible for providing analytical support (dashboard reporting/ad-hoc analysis/business reviews) to company-wide audiences from Sales, Marketing, Support, Product and Engineering. You are expected to not only fulfill stakeholders' analytical needs and deliver actionable business insights, but also are expected to take the lead to think about more questions to answer. We want you to own the analytics roadmap and optimize our business further.Communicate with team leads and executives. You will be responsible for presenting data and communicating insights to various stakeholders in an effective manner. You are expected to have strong people skills and strong communication skills to network and build rapport quickly.Must Haves:Bachelor's degree required with at least 4-6 years professional experience from highly analytical and data-intensive rolesMust be advanced in SQL and at least one data visualization tool (Mode / Tableau / Looker, etc.)Must have a strong business acumen to always understand the Whys behind any data requests and always be able to extract business insightsBe self-driven to lead initiatives from start to end and navigate through ambiguities and distractionsStrong people and communication skills to build great working relationshipsNice to Haves:Ability to work under pressure with multiple projects simultaneously and meet tight deadlinesExperience with building data pipeline jobsExperience with applying data science to drive business growthNote: This position is not eligible for Visa sponsorship.IND

The Job: Business Analyst

You will be responsible for the business analysis process for moderate size/complexity enterprise projects. You will lead the business analysis, estimation, and planning of a broad set of business requirements for enterprise clients using a structured requirements process. You will align the requirements to conform as much as possible to Agiloft standard/out-of-the-box configurations. You will also develop the preliminary technical specification.

You must have solid critical thinking and problem-solving skills, strong business acumen, excellent written and verbal communication abilities, and the ability to manage a virtual or in-person meeting room with multiple senior stakeholders.

Job Responsibilities

Lead the business analysis process for moderate size/complexity enterprise implementation projects.



Budget: Moderate (typically Implementation budget ranges from $200K to $700K
Complexity: Moderate (one or limited phases typically involving a limited set of client departments/processes and stakeholders).
Duration: 3 months to 8 months.


Lead the business analysis, estimation, and planning of a moderate set of business requirements for enterprise clients using a structured requirements process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, estimating, validating) and recommending options, risks, and cost vs. benefits.
Assist in the development/maintenance of standard/out-of-the-box configurations, workflows, processes, use-cases, and artifacts that can be leveraged for large enterprise clients licensing the Agiloft platform.
Showcase, recommend and align requirements for large enterprise prospects/clients to conform as much as possible to Agiloft standard/out-of-the-box configurations - which in turn reduces project risk, cost, and timelines.
Develop the preliminary technical specification for enterprise projects.
Be able to interpret gaps in enterprise client requirements and business needs, identify possible solutions to those gaps, and suggest those improvements to client business processes to make them more effective and easier to implement (ideally, should be aligned with Agiloft standard/out-of-the-box configurations).
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details and able to prioritize requirements based on business needs.
Problem Solving:

Identify, develop, and initiate innovations and solutions where precedents and procedures may not exist.
Work cross-functionally (typically with senior management) to offer alternate solutions and resolve more complex business analysis challenges

OverviewCome join the Intuit Customer Success Trust & Safety team as a Manager, Business Analysis, Trust and Safety. We are developing cutting edge data protection and fraud prevention capabilities. The security of Intuits operations and the trust and confidence instilled in Intuits stakeholders are of paramount importance to our customers and our organization.

In this role within the Trust & Safety team, you will manage a team of 4+ Business System analysts and will partner closely with the Security and Fraud engineering leadership team, Customer Success leaders, as well as stakeholders within Business Groups across the IT and Customer Success organization. You will apply and leverage security principles along with business processes to secure customer data and sensitive account information. In partnership with cross-functional teams including Information Security, Compliance, Legal and business unit product teams, you will synthesize business objectives and security data protection requirements to align on priorities across the TSP portfolio and coordinate across organizations for execution. Security expertise, knowledge of automation and AI/ML is essential in this role. These capabilities are key in order for the TSP organization to partner effectively and efficiently in service of delivering on strategy, core priorities and annual goals. This position requires strong analysis, excellent communication and the ability to manage high impact work on short deadlines.
What you'll bringWe are looking for a passionate, forward-thinking, results-oriented leader with security experience, and most importantly, have a people-focused mindset.

2 or more years of people management experience for a team of Information/Cyber Security business and data analysts. 5 or more years of experience required in related field Data Loss Prevention, Risk Management, Fraud Strategy, Customer Success Operations.Requires strong knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and proficiency in analyzing key insights. Strong ability to organize, analyze, interpret, and disseminate informationExcellent communication, interpersonal, leadership, presentation, and collaborative skills to work effectively with teams throughout organization in remote regions.Proactive and Self-directed, team player mindset is a must. Experience in execution and building relationships and working with executives at all levels.BS/BA degree in related discipline strongly desired i.e. Information Security, Fraud Operations

How you will lead

Manages team of security and fraud analysts to support fraud prevention strategy, policy, process, communications, and operational changes across core TSP Portfolio. Proactively identify security technologies to protect customer data, identify fraud trends and evaluate if they can materially impact business goals and targetsKnowledge and breath of security landscape (SIEM, Data Loss Prevention, Endpoint security, Network Security) is a must haveKnowledge of AI/ML to drive predictive behavioral analysis and deliver speed and efficiencies with automationTechnical skills in data-analysis (SQL, Python) to develop data driven insightsPartner with TSP Leadership to align on fraud performance metrics, vendor solution updates, and support system enhancementsWork closely with the TSP Leadership team to support creating, landing, measuring and enabling execution on the Security priorities and commitments.Establish and execute communications strategy and communications plan for on-going cross-functional and executive leadership communications to educate leadership on fraudulent activity, emerging industry trends and detection/prevention technology solutions to solve for the same.Collaborate with peers and leadership to maintain visibility into fraud-impacting operational changes across all functions.Build and deliver internal & external comms for summary of portfolio status in monthly leadership staff meetings, quarterly All Hands, monthly develop ship-it announcements, etc.Responsible for collaborating closely with key cross functional teams to ensure project timelines are met with efficiency and consideration of product launches and activities.Works across various company stakeholders to drive alignment on business outcomes to support Security workloads and help Security show up as a single voice. Serves as a key connecting person with Engineering, Product management, Data analytics and Program management to develop and align on messaging to leadership.
